intro: Kelleria patula, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, green, egg-shaped fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna habitats. The flowers emit a strong fragrance at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators like moths.
